title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: Since version 0.1.1, easiest way install electionsBR use install.packages function: Frequently, however, CRAN version recent one. cases, pre-release versions GitHub, can use following command:

title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: previous experience R required use electionsBR package. fact, takes two lines code download, clean, export Brazilian electoral data Stata SPSS formats. example, can easily obtain complete tidy dataset candidates’ background information 2010 Federal election using following code: setting export argument TRUE elections_tse function, package download clean relevant data directly TSE website save R working directory (function automatically tells user directory located) two different files: electoral_data.dta, used Stata; electoral_data.sav, used SPSS.

title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: electionsBR’s chief function, elections_tse, contains argument type (character), controls type electoral data retrieved. possible values type : vote_mun_zone: Downloads data verification, disaggregated cities electoral zones. details_mun_zone: Downloads data details, disaggregated town electoral zone. legends: Downloads data party denomination (coalitions parties), disaggregated cities. party_mun_zone: Downloads data polls parties, disaggregated cities electoral zones. personal_finances: Downloads data personal financial disclosures. observation corresponds candidate’s property. seats: Downloads data number seats dispute elections. vote_section: Downloads data candidate electoral results elections Brazil electoral section. voter_profile_by_section: Downloads data voters’ profile vote section. voter_profile: Downloads data voters’ profile. social_media: Downloads data candidates’ links social media federal elections. Using type argument, download electoral results 2014 federal elections, example, can use:
code: # Download electoral results for 2014 federal elections df <- elections_tse(year = 2014, type = "vote_mun_zone")

title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: package also provides alternative API downloading data CEPESP Data project, including information candidates, electoral results, voters’ profiles. download data candidates 2018 presidential election, simply use following code:

title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: electionsBR package also includes additional functionality may useful users. example, uf_br function returns character vector list state abbreviations: obtain list party abbreviations, use: recent years, TSE made available data presidential elections separate files (indicated BR _BR suffix). download files, use br_archive argument follows: obtain TSE’s official README files describe variables type electoral data, make sure set readme_pdf TRUE:
code: uf_br() parties_br(year) # Download electoral results for 2014 federal elections df <- elections_tse(year = 2014, type = "vote_mun_zone", br_archive = TRUE) # Download candidates' social media information for 2022 elections df <- elections_tse(year = 2014, type = "social_media", readme_pdf = TRUE)

title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: electionsBR’s functions accept export argument (logical, must TRUE FALSE; defaults latter) controls whether functions export retrieved data Stata SPSS files .

what: Removing UTF-8 special characters from texts
title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: default, electionsBR’s functions maintain original encoding (Latin-1) special characters. convert strings ASCII, set ascii argument TRUE. Using Mac OS, option may cause errors (may retrieve incomplete data 2016 elections). avoid issues, use encoding optional argument follows: encoding may also set UTF-8 valid encodings.
code: df <- elections_tse(2010, ascii = TRUE) df <- elections_tse(2010, ascii = TRUE, encoding = "Latin-1")

title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: Sometimes, getting state electoral data, whole country, one needs. achieve , use uf optional argument (available functions): Notice input must character vector – case insensitive state abbreviations (MG, Mg, mG, mg equally valid inputs).
code: # Electoral results for the 2010 federal elections in Sao Paulo (SP) df <- elections_tse(2010, uf = "SP") http://www.tse.jus.br/eleicoes/estatisticas/repositorio-de-dados-eleitorais # Electoral results for the 2010 federal elections in Minas Gerais (MS) df <- elections_tse(2010, uf = "mg")  # Electoral results for the 2010 federal elections in RS, SC, and PR df <- elections_tse(2010, uf = c("RS", "SC", "PR"))

title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: Federal elections state elections conducted simultaneously, including election president vice president, senators alternates, governors vice governors, federal deputies, state deputies. Two years later, municipal elections held mayors, vice mayors, city councils. important note distinction based federal level, branches government. executive legislative representatives elected time. case elections president vice president, governor vice governor, senator alternates, mayor vice mayor, majoritarian system used, candidate votes elected. none candidates president, governor, mayor municipality 200,000 inhabitants reaches absolute majority valid votes, second round held two voted candidates. city council elections, state deputies, federal deputies, proportional criterion used, takes account votes received candidate also votes received party. Therefore, candidate highest number votes may always elected. allocation seats depends performance entire group candidates party alliance.

title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: internal documentation electionsBR package based entirely official documentation provided TSE Repositório de Dados Eleitorais. access documentation type electoral data, set readme_pdf argument elections_tse TRUE package save relevant documentation PDF format.

title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: electionsBR package modify filter data provided TSE. Additionally, users must aware TSE updates databases frequently, important note version electoral data used. However, responsible issues data users may encounter.

title: Introduction to the electionsBR package
text: cite electionsBR publications, please use:
code: citation("electionsBR") ## To cite package 'electionsBR' in publications use: ##  ##   Meireles, Fernando; Silva, Denisson; Costa, Beatriz. (2016). ##   electionsBR: R functions to download and clean Brazilian electoral ##   data. URL: http://electionsbr.com/novo/ ##  ## A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is ##  ##   @Manual{, ##     title = {{electionsBR}: {R} Functions to Download and Clean {B}razilian Electoral Data}, ##     author = {Fernando Meireles and Denisson Silva and Beatriz Costa}, ##     year = {2016}, ##     url = {http://electionsbr.com/novo/}, ##     encoding = {UTF-8}, ##   }

title: Authors and Citation
text: Denisson Silva. Author, maintainer. Fernando Meireles. Author. Beatriz Costa. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Meireles, Fernando; Silva, Denisson; Costa, Beatriz. (2016). electionsBR: R functions download clean Brazilian electoral data. URL: http://electionsbr.com/novo/
code: @Manual{,   title = {{electionsBR}: {R} Functions to Download and Clean {B}razilian Electoral Data},   author = {Fernando Meireles and Denisson Silva and Beatriz Costa},   year = {2016},   url = {http://electionsbr.com/novo/},   encoding = {UTF-8}, }

what: An R package for downloading Brazilian electoral data
title: An R package for downloading Brazilian electoral data
text: 8 years 44,000+ downloads! electionsBR provides comprehensive set functions effortlessly retrieving cleaning Brazilian electoral data Brazilian Superior Electoral Court (TSE). package allows access several datasets local federal elections various positions, including city councilors, mayors, state deputies, federal deputies, governors, presidents, well data voters’ profiles, candidates’ social media, personal financial disclosures. package also provides alternative API download data CEPESP Data project.

title: An R package for downloading Brazilian electoral data
text: electionsBR CRAN can installed : electionsBR also available GitHub. can install pre-release versions via:

title: An R package for downloading Brazilian electoral data
text: download data specific election, simply provide year type arguments function call. instance, retrieve data candidates 2002 election, use following code: data types presidential elections, TSE provides results single file. download data, use br_archive argument follows: Export Brazilian electoral data Stata SPSS formats setting export optional argument TRUE (data saved working directory): subset results Brazilian states, use uf argument. example, get data votes municipal elections Rio Grande Sul (RS) 2000: detailed information package’s functionality complete list functions, see package vignette.
code: library(electionsBR) df <- elections_tse(year = 2002, type = "candidate") df <- elections_tse(year = 2022, type = "vote_mun_zone", br_archive = TRUE) df <- elections_tse(year = 2002, type = "candidate", export = TRUE) df <- elections_tse(year = 2000, type = "vote_mun_zone", uf = "RS")

what: Download data on the candidates' backgrounds in elections — candidate
title: Download data on the candidates' backgrounds in elections — candidate
text: candidate() downloads aggregates data candidates' background ran elections Brazil. function returns data.frame observation corresponds candidate.

title: Download data on the candidates' backgrounds in elections — candidate
code: candidate(   year,   uf = "all",   br_archive = FALSE,   encoding = "latin1",   temp = TRUE,   readme_pdf = FALSE )

title: Download data on the candidates' backgrounds in elections — candidate
text: year Election year (integer). function, years 1994, 1998, 2002, 2006, 2010, 2014, 2018, 2022, 2024 available. uf Federation Unit acronym (character vector). br_archive TSE's data repository, results can obtained whole country loading single within single file setting argument TRUE (may work elections , , recovers electoral data presidential elections, absent files). encoding Data original encoding (defaults 'latin1'). can changed avoid errors ascii = TRUE. temp (logical). temp readme_pdf original readme

what: R functions to download and clean Brazilian electoral Data — electionsBR-package
title: R functions to download and clean Brazilian electoral Data — electionsBR-package
text: electionsBR provides set tools easily pull clean several different Brazilian electoral data: election results; candidates' partisan affiliations, personal professional backgrounds; Brazilian parties' electoral performances; composition electoral coalitions; among many others.

title: R functions to download and clean Brazilian electoral Data — electionsBR-package
text: learn electionsBR, check package vignette documentation.

title: R functions to download and clean Brazilian electoral Data — electionsBR-package
text: Beatriz Costa (UFMG/Brazil) [ctb], Fernando Meireles (UFMG/Brazil) [author], Denisson Silva (UFMG/Brazil) [author]

Mayor Councillor positions, valid options range 2000 2016. type type data retrieve. Valid options "candidate" "vote". position position data requested. Valid options President, Governor, Senator, Federal Deputy, State Deputy, District Deputy, Mayor, Councillor. data_table set TRUE, function return data data.table object. Default FALSE.

Download data on the candidates' background in local elections — elections_rda
text: year Election year. function, years 1996, 2000, 2004, 2008, 2012, 2016, 2020, 2024 available local level. 1994, 1998, 2002, 2006, 2010, 2014, 2018, 2022 available federal level. level Election level podem ser fed (default) local. archive Corresponds one following options: candidate, download candidates' data; vote_mun_zone, download electoral results; legend, download data parties' labels; party_mun_zone, download electoral results party; personal_finances, download candidates' personal finances; details_mun_zone, download data verification elections; seats, download data available seats.

title: Download data on the candidates' background in local elections — elections_rda

what: Function for downloading electoral data from the TSE repository — elections_tse
title: Function for downloading electoral data from the TSE repository — elections_tse
text: elections_tse() function wrapper allows users download clean electoral data Brazil's TSE repository. function provides data candidates, electoral results, personal finances, election-related information 1998 2024. returned data.frame contains observations corresponding candidates, cities, electoral zones.

title: Function for downloading electoral data from the TSE repository — elections_tse
code: elections_tse(   year,   type,   uf = "all",   br_archive = FALSE,   ascii = FALSE,   encoding = "latin1",   export = FALSE,   temp = TRUE,   data_table = FALSE,   readme_pdf = FALSE )

title: Function for downloading electoral data from the TSE repository — elections_tse
text: year Election year. Valid options 1998, 2002, 2006, 2010, 2014, 2018, 2022 federal elections; 1996, 2000, 2004, 2008, 2012, 2016, 2020, 2024 municipal elections. type Requested data type. Valid options : elections_tse() function supports following types data downloads: * candidate: Downloads data candidates. observation corresponds candidate. * candidate_add_infor: Downloads data candidates - Addtional information. observation corresponds candidate, available 2024. * vote_mun_zone: Downloads data verification, disaggregated cities electoral zones. observation corresponds city/zone. * details_mun_zone: Downloads data details, disaggregated town electoral zone. observation corresponds town/zone. * legends: Downloads data party denomination (coalitions parties), disaggregated cities. observation corresponds city. * party_mun_zone: Downloads data polls parties, disaggregated cities electoral zones. observation corresponds city/zone. * personal_finances: Downloads data personal financial disclosures. observation corresponds candidate's property. * seats: Downloads data number seats dispute elections. * vote_section: Downloads data candidate electoral results elections Brazil electoral section. * voter_profile_by_section: Downloads data voters' profile vote section. * voter_profile: Downloads data voters' profile. * social_media: Downloads data candidates' links social media federal elections. uf Federation Unit acronym (character). br_archive TSE's data repository, results can obtained whole country loading single file setting argument TRUE (may work elections , others, retrieves electoral data presidential elections, absent files). ascii (logical). text transformed Latin-1 ASCII format? encoding Data original encoding (defaults 'Latin-1'). can changed avoid errors ascii = TRUE. export (logical). downloaded data saved .dta .sav files current directory? temp (logical). TRUE, keep temporary files future use (recommended). data_table returned object data.table? Defaults FALSE. readme_pdf original README file saved PDF working directory? Defaults FALSE.

title: Function for downloading electoral data from the TSE repository — elections_tse
text: elections_tse() function returns data.frame requested electoral data. elections_tse() returns data.frame following variables:

title: Function for downloading electoral data from the TSE repository — elections_tse
text: export set TRUE, downloaded data saved .dta .sav  files current directory.

title: Function for downloading electoral data from the TSE repository — elections_tse
text: elections prior 2002, information may incomplete. 2014 2018 elections, additional columns available. also important note recent years, TSE changed format data files, using CSV format header.

title: Function for downloading electoral data from the TSE repository — elections_tse

title: Download data on candidate electoral results in local elections in Brazil — vote_mun_zone_local
text: year Election year. function, years 1996, 2000, 2004, 2008, 2012, 2016, 2020, 2024 available. uf Federation Unit acronym (character vector). ascii (logical). text transformed Latin-1 ASCII format? encoding Data original encoding (defaults 'Latin-1'). can changed avoid errors ascii = TRUE. export (logical). downloaded data saved .dta .sav current directory? temp (logical). TRUE, keep temporary compressed file future use (recommended)

title: Download data on candidate electoral results in local elections in Brazil — vote_mun_zone_local
text: vote_mun_zone_local() returns data.frame following variables: DATA_GERACAO: Generation date file (data collected). HORA_GERACAO: Generation time file (data collected), Brasilia Time. ANO_ELEICAO: Election year. NUM_TURNO: Round number. DESCRICAO_ELEICAO: Description election. SIGLA_UF: Units Federation's acronym occurred election. SIGLA_UE: Units Federation's acronym (case major election FU's   acronym candidate runs (text) case municipal election   municipal's Supreme Electoral Court code (number)). Assume special values BR, ZZ   VT designate, respectively, Brazil, Overseas Absentee Ballot. CODIGO_MUNICIPIO: Supreme Electoral code city occurred election. NOME_MUNICIPIO: Name city occurred election. NUMERO_ZONA: Zone number. CODIGO_CARGO: Code position candidate runs . NUMERO_CANDIDATO: Candidate's number ballot box. SQ_CANDIDATO: Candidate's sequence number generated internally electoral NOME_CANDIDATO: Candidate's complete name. NOME_URNA_CANDIDATO: Candidate's ballot box name. DESCRICAO_CARGO: Description position candidate runs . COD_SIT_CAND_TOT: Candidate's totalization status code election round. NUMERO_PARTIDO: Party number. SIGLA_PARTIDO: Party's acronym. NOME_PARTIDO: Party name. SEQUENCIAL_LEGENDA: Coalition's sequential number, generated internally electoral justice. NOME_COLIGACAO: Coalition name. COMPOSICAO_LEGENDA: Coalition's composition. TOTAL_VOTOS: Total votes. TRANSITO: Electoral result outside candidates' district? (N ).

text: export set TRUE, downloaded data saved .dta .sav  files current directory.

electionsBR 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-17 new minor release, inclusion additional function candidate data, TSE created new file referring applications additional information. addition allows users download electoral data 1998 2024.

title: electionsBR 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-02-05 new minor release, unified functions download clean electoral data using improved internal functions. addition , also added support get data CepespData’s API (cepespdata.io), allows users download electoral data 1998 2018. update, hope package robust easier maintain.

title: electionsBR 0.4.0
text: Implemented httr’s GET download files, avoiding TSE’s server instability. Wrapped functions download clean electoral data single function, elections_tse(), calls appropriate internal functions; original functions now return deprecation warnings. Added support download data CepespData’s API using elections_cepesp() function. Added functionality download candidates’ personal financial data social media information using elections_tse() function.

title: electionsBR 0.4.0
text: Fixed functions vote_section_local vote_mun_zone_fed. Fixed br_archive argument handle different file naming conventions. Added httr backend download files track progress. Updated README documentation. Updated citation file.

title: electionsBR 0.3.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-01-30 minor update fixing functions download clean electoral data voting sections municipal elections. also added support continuous integrations tests GitHub Actions.

title: electionsBR 0.3.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-01-30 long due minor update (1) fixes bugs improve couple functions, (2) adds new functions document others better. Added voter_profile_by_section function extract clean voters’ profile information aggregated voting sections. Added support download recent Brazilian electoral data, including recent one held 2020. Improved functions better deal errors loading local data. Exported pipe make convenient use package analysis. Updated documentation.

title: electionsBR 0.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2019-07-09 minor update bug fixes improvements. Fixed fill issues data.table’s fread reading local data. Included new argument functions allows users load electoral data different elections levels. Included new functions download data Rdata format directly private web server. Replaced data.table’s fread read data (Brazilian Electoral Court started using file formats). version , functions internally use tidyverse’s read_delim read electoral data. Updated documentation.

title: electionsBR 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-06-06 changed central aspects package, affected functions (without compromising backward compatibility). Beyond , update best make package user friendly: created vignette, included options filter customize functions’ outputs, added specific functions (including one easily export electoral data). new update, package also gained website. Overall, : Updated package (1) load clean data faster (data.tables’ fread() rbindlist()), (2) make package robust human errors (new internal functions test inputs), (3) return simples object (dplyr tbl). Included two new functions summarize presidential runoff results state (president_state_vote()) municipality (president_mun_vote()). Included two new functions summarize legislative election results state (legislative_state_vote()) municipality (legislative_mun_vote()). Included one new function get data number seats disputed election (available_seats()). Included optional argument functions export electoral data Stata SPSS. Included optional argument functions filter results state (UF). Created one vignette. Updated README.

title: electionsBR 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-12-13 Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Included year = 2016 option local elections. Updated candidate_local documentation. Included option convert electoral data Latin-1 encoding ASCII. Removed exportation internal functions. Added new function, voter_affiliation, collect data voters’ affiliation. Added new function, voter_profile, collect data voters’ profile. Fixed encoding issue joining collected data (avoid errors Macs). Added new internal function, test_encoding, validate encodings passed functions’ calls. Replaced cat message functions. Users now free suppress unwanted messages. Added CITATION file /inst.
